DOC.brief_summary: Recently clinical prediction rule ( CPR ) develop validate accurately identifies patient low back pain likely benefit lumbo-pelvic manipulation . The study develop validated rule use identical manipulation procedure . However , recent evidence suggest different manual therapy technique may result outcome.Purpose : The purpose study investigate effectiveness three different manual therapy technique subgroup patient low back pain satisfy CPR .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Three Manual Physical Therapy Techniques Subgroup Patients With Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: 1 . Chief complaint pain and/or numbness lumbar spine , buttock , and/or low extremity 2 . Oswestry disability score least 25 % 3 . Age great 18 year less 60 year 4 . At least four five follow criterion : 1 . Duration current episode < 16 day ( judged patient 's selfreport ) 2 . No symptom extend distal knee ( judge pain diagram ) 3 . FABQW score < 19 4 . At least one hip > 350 internal rotation range motion ( measure prone ) 5 . Stiffness lumbar spine ( judged segmental mobility test ) 1 . Red flag note participant 's general medical screening questionnaire ( i.e . tumor , metabolic disease , RA , osteoporosis , prolonged history steroid use , etc . ) 2 . Signs consistent nerve root compression , include one following : 1 . Reproduction low back leg pain straight leg raise le 450 2 . Muscle weakness involve major muscle group low extremity 3 . Diminished low extremity muscle stretch reflex ( Quadriceps Achilles tendon ) 4 . Diminished absent sensation pinprick low extremity dermatome 3 . Prior surgery lumbar spine buttock 4 . Current pregnancy 5 . Past medical history osteoporosis spinal compression fracture 6 . Inability comply treatment schedule ( weekly session four week )
